page.title: 04Social concerns-Education
page.content: In common with the majority residents of Thorncombe are concerned with maintaining a standard of living in their comunity and look with apprehenssion at the figures of unemployment in the south west. They take great interest in the education of their children and their future prospects. Many people have moved into the area for the rural way of life and while welcoming improvements in the amenities, are anxious that any large scale changes may interfere with the way of life they have sought for themselves and their children. Education is the responsibility of the Dorset County Council. A village school for 5-11+ year olds was built the mid 70s after fire destroyed the old church school. Children over 11+ continue their education in Lyme Regis and then on to the county colleges.
